summary: The bill, the NRCS Wetland Compliance and Appeals Reform Act, focuses on reforming the Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) regarding wetland regulations. It addresses issues like woody vegetation removal, retroactive penalties, burden of proof in violation cases, and appeal processes. The bill includes provisions for customer satisfaction surveys, state oversight committees, and changes to the appeals process to ensure fairness. It also prohibits the acquisition of permanent easements and modifies regulations for improved transparency.
